docs.title: Academic Technology: Generative AI API Access Guide
docs.text:
(For Harvard FAS, GSAS, and GSE affiliates – faculty & students)

Welcome to your secure, short-term gateway to OpenAI's powerful Large Language Model (LLM) APIs, managed by Harvard Academic Technology. This service supports academic research, course work, and exploration—typically for one academic term or less.

docs.title: Eligibility
docs.text:
• Harvard FAS, GSAS, or GSE faculty or student
  • Academic project, research, or course

docs.title: What you get
docs.text: Service Component Detail API Key: Direct access to the OpenAI API and models (GPT-3.5, GPT-4, etc) Duration: Short-term (up to one academic term per project) Starter Notebook: No code jupyter notebook guide to getting started using API in python

docs.title: ⚠️ Critical Usage & Policy Requirements
docs.text:
Please review these fundamental rules before requesting an API key:

Policy Area Details Usage Limit: $25 of API credit per key, for the duration of the term. Eligibility: Only FAS, GSAS, and GSE affiliates are eligible. HBS, HMS affiliates should contact their local IT team. Authentication: Request form requires HarvardKey login. Key Security: Do not share your API key in public or team spaces (Slack, GitHub, SharePoint, etc.). Each user must have a unique key. Distribution: If given multiple keys (for a class/workshop), securely distribute and instruct recipients in safe handling.

docs.title: Next Step
docs.text: • See how to request and use your API key ».

docs.title: Request & Delivery Process
docs.text:
This guide outlines how your request for an API key moves from submission to secure delivery.

API key security is essential at every step.

docs.title: Four Simple Steps
docs.text:
1. Submit: Complete the API Key Request Form (HarvardKey required)
  2. Review: The Academic Technology team reviews your request (usually within 2–3 business days)
  3. Receive: Your API key and starter notebook link will be delivered via encrypted Harvard email or secure file transfer
  4. Start: Begin your project!

docs.title: Quick Reference Table
docs.text: Step You Do We Do Result 1 Submit form w/ project details (HarvardKey) Review, approve, track Request queued 2 Wait Provision key in API portal Key created 3 Save your key & link from secure email / file transfer we send Store key securely and share other keys via secure delivery Access granted 4 Complete starter notebook and begin your project Close ticket Academic work begins

docs.title: Security Reminders
docs.text:
• Never post/share your API key publicly (Slack, GitHub, email, etc.)
  • If distributing keys for others, one per user—instruct recipients about key security
  • The Starter Notebook provides secure setup guidance

🚀 REQUEST YOUR API KEY (Harvard Qualtrics Form)

Next, see Resources & Support or Return to Home

docs.title: Getting Started with Your Access
docs.text:
Once you receive your key:

  • API Access: Enables use of the OpenAI Direct API for integration in research/code/projects.
    • Note: This is NOT the public ChatGPT website.
  • Starter Notebook: Use the Generative AI API Starter Notebook – beginner-friendly, no programming required.
    • Recommended: Launch directly in your browser with Google Colab.
